children.name: Example
children.text: var client = new sn_clotho.Client();

children.name: Client()
children.text: Create an instance of the client class to access the MetricBase database.

children.name: Example
children.text: var time = new GlideDateTime(); // total_power is the name of a metric within building_a which stores accumulated values var dataBuilder1 = new sn_clotho.DataBuilder(building_a, "total_power"); // values to be accumulated dataBuilder1.add(time, 3.5); new sn_clotho.Client().accumulate(dataBuilder1, 0); var dataBuilder2 = new sn_clotho.DataBuilder(building_a, "total_power"); // values to be accumulated dataBuilder2.add(time, 3.5); new sn_clotho.Client().accumulate(dataBuilder2, 0); var dataBuilder3 = new sn_clotho.DataBuilder(building_a, "total_power"); // values to be accumulated dataBuilder3.add(time, 3.5); new sn_clotho.Client().accumulate(dataBuilder3, 0); // As a result of these operations client will save value of // 3.5+12+4.3+0(default value) at the timestamp 'time'
children.text2: The following shows how to accumulate the total_power metric value in a record called building_a.

children.name: now_GR
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
Name of the series GlideRecord from which to obtain the accumulated value.

See also: getSeries()

children.name: default_value
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Optional. Default value for accumulation at a given timestamp. Used only during the first call to accumulate if a value is unavailable for a given timestamp.

A use case could be accumulating a watts metric for a total_power. You want to accumulate watts for a router connected to an outlet without a power meter to measure it. If you know the consumption value and it is constant), you can use the constant value as a default value to accumulate total_power. For example, you would use 20 if the router is constantly plugged in and consumes 20 Watts.

The timestamp value can be provided using the DataBuilder API.

Default: 0

children.name: accumulate(GlideRecord now_GR, String metric)
children.text: Accumulates metric values at specified timestamp and saves the result to the database rather than overwriting the value.
children.text2: Use this method to handle metrics that can be summed for an accumulation, such as kilowatt-hours (kWhs) of electricity. Accumulate makes a call for each metric at the provided timestamp. For example, collected kilowatts for a heater, electric kettle and washing machine would result in three calls to accumulate.

children.name: Example
children.text: var client = new sn_clotho.Client(); // delete metric (Speed) from the Drones table client.deleteMetric("mb_demo_drone", "mb_demo_mt_speed");
children.text2: The following  shows how to remove a metric from a table.

children.name: tableName
children.text: String
children.text2: The name of the table whose specified metric is to be deleted.

children.name: metricName
children.text: String
children.text2: The name of the metric.

children.name: deleteMetric(String tableName, String metricName)
children.text: Remove a specified metric from a specified table in the MetricBase database
children.text2: Note: This method deletes data from the MetricBase database. There is no recovery mechanism.

children.name: now_GR
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
The records whose time series data for the specified metric is to be
                deleted.

children.name: Example
children.text: var client = new sn_clotho.Client(); //query drones of a specific model var drones = new GlideRecord("mb_demo_drone"); drones.addQuery("model", "Kingfisher Phantom"); drones.query(); client.deleteSeries(drones, 'mb_demo_mt_speed');

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: metric
children.text: String
children.text2: The name of the metric.

children.name: deleteSeries(GlideRecord now_GR, String metric)
children.text: Remove the data in the MetricBase database associated with the specified metric in the specified GlideRecord. Use this method for removing test data.
children.text2: Note: This method deletes data from the MetricBase database. There is no recovery mechanism.

children.name: Array
children.text: List of string sys_ids representing the series containing data for the specified metric. If the lastUpdateBefore parameter is provided, returns series that have no data more recent than the lastUpdateBefore date (non-inclusive).

children.name: Example
children.text: var client = new sn_clotho.Client(); // query subject records var grDrone = new GlideRecord('mb_demo_drone'); grDrone.query(); var series = client.getSeries(grDrone,'mb_demo_mt_speed');
children.text2:
The following  shows how to get the complete list of speed values listed in the
        Drones [mb_demo_drone] table.

children.name: now_GR
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2: The record from which to obtain the series.

children.name: metric
children.text: String
children.text2: The name of the metric.

children.name: lastUpdateBefore
children.text: GlideDateTime
children.text2:
Optional. Date in the future representing the end of the period to be
                evaluated.

children.name: getSeries(GlideRecord now_GR, String metricName, GlideDateTime lastUpdateBefore)
children.text: Get all series from a specific dimension.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: metricData
children.text: Object
children.text2:
One of the following:
  • DataBuilder object containing metric data.
  • Array of DataBuilder objects containing metric data.

children.name: Example
children.text: var time = new GlideDateTime(); ​ // two different GlideRecord instances and metrics var dataBuilder = new sn_clotho.DataBuilder(now_GR, 'cpu_percentage'); dataBuilder.add(time, 0.6); ​ var dataBuilder2 = new sn_clotho.DataBuilder(gr2, 'disk_free_percentage'); dataBuilder2.add(time, 0.2); ​ new sn_clotho.Client().put([dataBuilder,dataBuilder2]);

children.name: put(Object metricData)
children.text: Saves metric data to the MetricBase database.

name: Client - Scoped, Global
text: Provides methods to add data to the MetricBase database, to execute transforms on the MetricBase database, and to receive the results of the transforms.
text2:
The Client class can be used in scoped and global server scripts. When using the Client class, use the sn_clotho namespace identifier.

This class is part of the MetricBase application.

children.name: GlideDateTime
children.text: The end of the time period.

children.name: getEnd()
children.text: Returns the end time for data in the Data object.

children.name: String
children.text: The label assigned to the data.

children.name: getLabel()
children.text: Returns the label assigned by the sn_clotho.ClothoTransform.label() method.

children.name: String
children.text:
Name of the metric field. Returns null when the data object is associated with
                multiple data series.

children.name: getMetricName()
children.text:
Returns the name of the metric of the data series. Returns null when the data object is
    associated with multiple data series.

children.name: Number
children.text: The elapsed time in seconds.

children.name: getPeriod()
children.text: Returns the time period in milliseconds.

children.name: GlideDateTime
children.text: The time for the first data point.

children.name: getStart()
children.text: Returns the start time for data in the Data object.

children.name: String
children.text:
The subject field value of the subject GlideRecord. This is generally the
                sys_id of the subject GlideRecord.

children.name: getSubject()
children.text:
Returns the subject of the data series. Returns null when the data object is associated
    with multiple data series.

children.name: String
children.text:
Table name. Returns null when the data object is associated with multiple data
                series.

children.name: getTableName()
children.text:
Returns the name of the table assigned in the DataSelector class constructor. Returns
    null when the data object is associated with multiple data series.

children.name: Array
children.text: An array of numbers.

children.name: getValues()
children.text: Returns an array of values.

children.name: Number
children.text: The number of values in the object.

children.name: size()
children.text: Returns the number of values in the Data object.

name: Data - Scoped, Global
text: A Data object contains the results of transform performed by a sn_clotho.Client.transform() method.
text2:
Do not use a constructor to create an instance of this class, instead use the object returned by the sn_clotho.Client.transform() method.

The Data class can be used in scoped and global server scripts. When using the Data class, use the sn_clotho namespace identifier.

This class is part of the MetricBase application.

children.name: glideRecord
children.text: Object
children.text2: GlideRecord from which to obtain the domain.

children.name: Example
children.text: // Where cpu_percentage is the name of the metric var dataBuilder = new sn_clotho.DataBuilder(now_GR, 'cpu_percentage');

children.name: subject
children.text: String
children.text2: The sys_id of the GlideRecord associated with this series.

children.name: metric
children.text: String
children.text2: The field name of the metric.

children.name: DataBuilder(Object glideRecord, String subject, String metric)
children.text: Creates an instance of the DataBuilder class.

children.name: DataBuilder
children.text: The same DataBuilder object.

children.name: start
children.text: GlideDateTime
children.text2:
The time stamp for the first data point. Subsequent time stamps are calculated
                using the retention policy collection period.

children.name: Example
children.text: var points = [7,0.5,273]; var dataBuilder = new sn_clotho.DataBuilder(now_GR, 'cpu_percentage'); // this creates a GlideDateTime object set to the current date and time var time = new GlideDateTime(); dataBuilder.add(time, points);

children.name: value
children.text: Array
children.text2: An array of numbers.

children.name: add(GlideDateTime start, Array value)
children.text:
Add a series of data points to the DataBuilder object. Each data point is a time stamp
    and a value.
children.text2: Uses the start parameter and the retention policy collection period to calculate the time stamp for each value in the array. The first value has the start parameter as the time stamp. This method does not save the data in the MetricBase database. Use the sn_clotho.Client.put() method to save the values.

children.name: start
children.text: GlideDateTime
children.text2: The time stamp for the data point.

children.name: Example
children.text: var dataBuilder = new sn_clotho.DataBuilder(now_GR, 'cpu_percentage'); // this creates a GlideDateTime object set to the current date and time var time = new GlideDateTime(); dataBuilder.add(time, 0.6);

children.name: DataBuilder
children.text: The DataBuilder object.

children.name: value
children.text: Number
children.text2: The value of the data point.

children.name: add(GlideDateTime start, Number value)
children.text: Add a data point to the DataBuilder object. Each data point is a time stamp and a value. This method does not save the data point in the metric. Use the sn_clotho.Client.put() method to save the values.

name: DataBuilder - Scoped, Global
text: Use the DataBuilder class to create a series of data points for a metric. Use the sn_clotho.Client.put() method to save the values.
text2:
The DataBuilder class can be used in scoped and global server scripts. When using the DataBuilder class, use the sn_clotho namespace identifier.

This class is part of the MetricBase application.

children.name: table
children.text: String
children.text2: Metric table name listed in the Time Series Metrics [sys_metric] table.

children.name: Example
children.text: var metricInfo = new sn_clotho.MetricInfo('mb_demo_drone','mb_demo_mt_altitude');
children.text2: The following shows how to construct a MetricInfo object with the Altitude (mb_demo_mt_altitude) metric associated with the Drones [mb_demo_drone] table.

children.name: metric
children.text: String
children.text2:
Metric field name listed in the Time Series Metrics [sys_metric] table. This
                field name must be mapped to the table name.

children.name: MetricInfo(String table, String metric)
children.text: Creates an instance of the MetricInfo class.

children.name: Output
children.text:
Retention duration is: 8 days, Sampling period is: 1 minutes
Retention duration is: 94 days, Sampling period is: 10 minutes
Retention duration is: 397 days, Sampling period is: 60 minutes

children.name: Example
children.text: // Function to convert minutes to days function toDays(minutes) { return minutes / 60 / 24; }; var metricInfo = new sn_clotho.MetricInfo('mb_demo_drone','mb_demo_mt_altitude'); var schedules = metricInfo.getRetentionSchedulesInMinutes(); var log = ''; // Compiles a log message with retention schedules for (var duration in schedules) { log += "Retention duration is: " + toDays(duration) + " days, Sampling period is: " + schedules[duration] + " minutes\n"; } gs.info(log);
children.text2:
The following  shows how to loop over the retention policy schedules and compile a
        log message. The message contains the retention durations converted from minutes to days
        with their corresponding sampling periods.

children.name: Object
children.text:
JSON object containing key-value pairs that represent the retention policy schedules (in minutes) for the specified metric listed in the Retention Policies [sys_metric_retention_policy] table.
For each retention policy schedule belonging to the metric, the object contains a corresponding key-value pair that maps the retention duration to the sampling period.
  • Key – Retention duration of the retention policy schedule in minutes.

    Data type: String

  • Value – Sampling period of the retention policy schedule in minutes.

    Data type: Number

"<retentionDuration>": <samplingPeriod>

children.name: getRetentionSchedulesInMinutes()
children.text: Gets the retention policy schedules of the specified metric.
children.text2: See also MetricBase retention policies.

children.name: Example
children.text: var metricInfo = new sn_clotho.MetricInfo('mb_demo_drone','mb_demo_mt_altitude'); if (metricInfo.isValid()) { var retentionSchedules = metricInfo.getRetentionSchedulesInMinutes(); gs.info(JSON.stringify(retentionSchedules, null, 2)); } else { gs.info("metricInfo is invalid"); }
children.text2:
The following  shows how to check if the Altitude (mb_demo_mt_altitude) metric is in
        the Drones [mb_demo_drone] table, and return its retention schedule if it is. The example
        output reflects the policy duration in minutes mapped to its interval sampling period.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the metric specified in a MetricInfo object is mapped to the specified table.

Valid values:
  • true: Specified metric is valid.
  • false: Specified metric or table either does not exist or the metric is not mapped to the table.

children.name: isValid()
children.text: Indicates whether the specified metric is mapped to the table defined in a MetricInfo object.

name: MetricInfo
text: Provides methods to check if a metric is in the MetricBase database, and if so, to report its retention policy. Retention policies are reported in minutes.
text2:
The MetricInfo class can be used in scoped and global server scripts. When using the MetricInfo class, use the sn_clotho namespace identifier.

This class is part of the MetricBase application.

children.name: Example
children.text: //where drones is a GlideRecord created from a table with a metric field var builder = new sn_clotho.Transformer(drones);

children.name: sourceRecords
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
Contains the records for which metrics are to be evaluated. Can be one record
                or many.

children.name: Transformer( GlideRecord sourceRecords)
children.text: Create a Transformer object.

children.name: start
children.text: GlideDateTime
children.text2: The beginning of the period to be evaluated.

children.name: Example
children.text: var minutesAgoStart = 60; var end = new GlideDateTime(); var start = new GlideDateTime(end); start.addSeconds(-1 * 60 * minutesAgoStart); // query subject records var grDrone = new GlideRecord('mb_demo_drone'); grDrone.query(); // building transform; get the average transforms of a metric, grouping by model var transformer = new sn_clotho.Transformer(grDrone); transformer.groupBy("fleet").metric("mb_demo_mt_altitude").avg().label('avg - %g:fleet:'); // execute and return result for visualization var tfrmResult = transformer.execute(start, end);

children.name: TransformResult
children.text: The transformed data.

children.name: end
children.text: GlideDateTime
children.text2: The end of the period to be evaluated.

children.name: execute(GlideDateTime start, GlideDateTime end)
children.text: Run the transform.
children.text2:
Use the metric() and groupBy() methods before calling execute(). The execute() method can only be called once for each Transformer object.

Actions performed as part of the transform do not change the data in the MetricBase database.

children.name: field
children.text: String
children.text2: A field in the table to be used to group the transform results.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify the transform
                characteristics.

children.name: Example
children.text: var transformer = new sn_clotho.Transformer(grDrone); var trnsfrm = transformer.groupBy("fleet");

children.name: groupBy(String field)
children.text: Specify a field to be used to group the data.
children.text2: If you are going to use the groupBy() method, it must be called before the execute() method.

children.name: Example
children.text: var transformer = new sn_clotho.Transformer(grDrone); var trnsfrm = transformer.metric("mb_demo_mt_altitude");

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify the transform
                characteristics.

children.name: metricName
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the metric field.

children.name: metric(String metricName)
children.text: Specify the metric field to be used in the transform.
children.text2: You can specify multiple metrics to be used in the transform. The metric() method cannot be called after the execute() method is called.

name: Transformer
text:
Manipulate time-series data to prepare the data for evaluation and
    analysis.

children.name: constant
children.text: Number
children.text2: The number to add to the value in each time stamp.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: add(Number constant)
children.text: Add the specified number to the value in each time stamp.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: avg()
children.text:
Aggregate the selected metric series into one series containing the average value for
    each time stamp.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: count
children.text: Number
children.text2: The number of series to return. The series are labeled 0 to count - 1.

children.name: bottom(Number count)
children.text:
Create a result set that for each time stamp returns specified number of bottom values.
    This method results in 'count' number of series. Each value retains the label of its source
    series.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: ceiling
children.text: Number
children.text2: The maximum allowed value for any time stamp.

children.name: ceil(Number ceiling)
children.text:
Replace the value in any time stamp that is greater than the specified value with the
    specified value.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: collect()
children.text: Mark this transform for collection.
children.text2: Transforms that are part of a chain, but not the last transform, are by default not collected. A collected transform is returned as part of the transform result.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: count()
children.text:
Aggregate the selected metric series into one series containing the number of values
    for each time stamp.

children.name: constant
children.text: Number
children.text2: The number by which to divide the value of each time stamp.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: div(Number constant)
children.text: Divide the value in each time stamp by the specified number.

children.name: aggregator
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Can be:
  • AVG
  • CHISQUARE
  • LAST
  • MAX
  • MEDIAN
  • MIN
  • STDDEV
For definitions of these options, see MetricBase transforms.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text: TransformPart object that you can use to specify transform characteristics.

children.name: duration
children.text: Object
children.text2: Time period for the series.

children.name: filter(Object aggregator, Object duration)
children.text: Create a series using the specified aggregator for the specified time.

children.name: floor
children.text: Number
children.text2: The minimum value for any time stamp.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: floor(Number floor)
children.text:
Replace the value in any time stamp that is less than the specified value with the
    specified value.

children.name: fractions
children.text: Array of numbers
children.text2: The fractions to use on the input series.

children.name: Example
children.text: // returns a single series containing the median for each time stamp, which // means that half a time stamp's values are below the returned value fractiles([.5]) // returns four series, one series for each of the 25%, 50%, 75%, and 100% quartiles fractiles([.25, .5, .75, 1]) // returns the median, 95% percentile, the max value fractiles([.50, .95, 1])

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform characteristics.
                Contains one series for each fraction specified.

children.name: fractiles(Array fractions)
children.text:
Create series made up of the value that the specified percentage of values is below.
    Returns a series for each fraction in the specified array.
children.text2: The value in a time stamp in a returned series is the value at which the specified fraction of the samples for that time stamp is below. For example, if the fraction is 0.5, then the value in the time stamp is the value where half the values in the input series are below (median).

children.name: Example
children.text: var t = new sn_clotho.Transformer(drones); t.metric("mb_demo_mt_altitude"); var avgTform = t.avg(); t.execute(); var avgTformResult = avgTform.getResult();

children.name: TransformResult
children.text:
Contains the transform results associated with this part of the
                transform.

children.name: getResult()
children.text: Return the part of the result relevant to this transform.
children.text2: The collect() method must be called before the execute() method, and the execute() method must be called before calling the getResult() method.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text: A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform characteristics.

children.name: field
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of a field in the table by which to group the transform results.

children.name: Example
children.text: transformer.groupBy("fleet,model").metric("mb_demo_mt_altitude").avg().label('%g:fleet: - %g:model:'); var transformPart = transformer.groupBy("fleet,model") transformPart.metric("mb_demo_mt_altitude").avg().label('%g:fleet: - %g:model:');
children.text2:
The following  shows how to group altitude average metrics by fleet and model
        fields.

children.name: groupBy(String field)
children.text:
Specify a field by which to group data. To specify multiple fields, run successive
    calls individually.
children.text2: Note: The groupBy() method cannot be called after a transform has been run.

children.name: count
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Specifies the number of data samples in each direction to check for a non NaN
                value. If if a non NaN value is not found, NaN is used.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: interpolate(Object count)
children.text: Create a data value for a NaN data item by interpolating from adjacent data values.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text: A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform characteristics.

children.name: iqr()
children.text: Perform an Interquartile range transform.
children.text2:
Creates a result set of four series.

  • IQR, the median of all entries
  • IQR range, below Q1-1.5IQR, or above Q3+1.5IQR
  • Q1, the median of the smallest half of entries
  • Q3, the median of the largest half of entries

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: label
children.text: String
children.text2: The label for the transform results.

children.name: label(String label)
children.text: Add a label for the resulting series.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: count
children.text: Object
children.text2: A number of time stamps.

children.name: limit(Object count)
children.text:
Returns at most the specified number of values, starting at the most recent non-NaN
    value.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: base
children.text: Number
children.text2: The base for the logarithm calculation.

children.name: log(Number base)
children.text:
Run a logarithm on the value in each time stamp where the result is the log of the
    specified base for the time stamp value.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: max()
children.text: Returns a series with the maximum value for each time stamp.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: median()
children.text:
Create a series containing the median of values for each time stamp across a set of
    series.
children.text2: If there are n series in the TranformPart object, then if n is odd, the (n / 2 + 1) value for a time stamp is the median. If n is even, the average of the (n / 2) and (n / 2 + 1) values for a time stamp is the median.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: metric
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the metric field.

children.name: metric(String metric)
children.text: Specify the metric field to be used in the transform.
children.text2: You can specify multiple metrics to be used in the transform. The metric() method cannot be called after the transform has been run.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: min()
children.text: Returns a series with the minimum value for each time stamp.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: constant
children.text: Number
children.text2: The number by which to multiply the value of each time stamp.

children.name: mul(Number constant)
children.text: Multiply the value in each time stamp by the specified number.

children.name: aggregator
children.text: String
children.text2: The aggregator to use. Can be min, max, avg, or last.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: duration
children.text: GlideDateTime or an ISO 8601 formatted string
children.text2: The interval length.

children.name: base
children.text: GlideDateTime or an ISO 8601 formatted string
children.text2:
The zero offset for partitioning. For example, if you partition by day (24h),
                then set the base to Monday at midnight in your time zone. If you partition by 30
                days, then set the base to  1st day of the most recent month.

children.name: partition(String aggregator, GlideDateTime duration, GlideDateTime base)
children.text: Partition the series into intervals of the same duration.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: count
children.text: Number
children.text2: The number of samples to include in the result.

children.name: resample(Number count)
children.text: Specify the number of data points to include in the result.
children.text2:
Aligns a series with a fixed number of data points in the given range. If the original series has more data points than specified, multiple values are averaged. If the original series has fewer data points than specified, data points are added by interpolating data points between existing data points.

You can use the resample() method to reduce the number of samples in the result to more closely match the number of samples you are going to display.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text: A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform characteristics.

children.name: min
children.text: Number
children.text2:
The minimum number of samples to include in the result. If not enough samples
                are available, interpolation is used to create samples.

children.name: max
children.text: Number
children.text2: The maximum number of samples to include in the result.

children.name: resample(Number min, Number max)
children.text: Specify the minimum and maximum number of samples to include in the result.
children.text2:
This method is useful when you are showing series with different time periods (granularities).

This method determines the average number of points per series and if that fits between the specified minimum and maximum, each series is resampled to that average number of points. If the calculated average is greater than the maximum specified or smaller than the minimum specified, the specified maximum or minimum is used.

children.name: aggregator
children.text: String
children.text2: Can be LAST, AVG, MIN, or MAX.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text: A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform characteristics.

children.name: duration
children.text: GlideDuration
children.text2: The time period for the result set.

children.name: resample(String aggregator, GlideDuration duration)
children.text:
Specify an aggregator to use to create a result set over the specified duration. The
    aggregator can be LAST, AVG, MIN, or MAX.
children.text2:
Resamples the underlying data to the requested period.

  • When the time series is stored at a 1 minute interval and resample(AVG, new GlideDuration("1:00")) is called, the result will have one data point at every hour reflecting the average of the previous 60 values.
  • When the period requested is smaller than the period of the data, interpolation is used to calculate the intervening data points.

You can use the resample() method to reduce the number of samples in the result to more closely match the number of samples you are going to display.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text: A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform characteristics.

children.name: aggregator
children.text: String
children.text2: Can be LAST, AVG, MIN, or MAX.

children.name: numValues
children.text: Number
children.text2:
The number of samples to include in the result set.

When the number of values requested is greater than the number of values in the data for the requested time period, interpolate() is used to add values between existing points to reach the requested number of values.

children.name: resample(String aggregator, Number numValues)
children.text:
Specify an aggregator to use to create a result set of the specified size. The
    aggregator can be LAST, AVG, MIN, or MAX.
children.text2: You can use the resample() method to reduce the number of samples in the result to more closely match the number of samples you are going to display.

children.name: precision
children.text: Number
children.text2: The value to be used in the rounding calculation.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: round(Number precision)
children.text: Round the value in each time stamp to the specified precision.
children.text2:
Performs this calculation on each value.

(v / precision) * precision

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: stddev()
children.text:
Create a series containing the standard deviation of values for each time stamp across
    a set of series.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: constant
children.text: Object
children.text2: The number to subtract from the value in each time stamp.

children.name: sub(Object constant)
children.text: Subtract the specified number from the value in each time stamp.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: sum()
children.text:
Aggregate the selected metric series into one series containing the sum of all values
    for each time stamp.

children.name: count
children.text: Number
children.text2: The number of series to return. The series are labeled 0 to count - 1.

children.name: TransformPart
children.text:
A TransformPart object that can be used to specify transform
                characteristics.

children.name: top(Number count)
children.text:
Create a result set that for each time stamp returns the specified number of top
    values. This method results in 'count' number of series. Each value retains the label of its
    source series.

name: TransformPart
text: Use the TransformPart class to specify details of the transform to be done.

children.name: Array
children.text: An array of Data objects, with each object corresponding to a group.

children.name: byGroup()
children.text:
Returns an array of Data objects. Returns an error if no group was specified for the
    transform.

children.name: Data
children.text: The Data object with the transform results.

children.name: label
children.text: String
children.text2: The label that identifies the data to be retrieved.

children.name: getByLabel(String label)
children.text: Returns the transformed data with the specified label.

children.name: Data
children.text: The Data object with the transform results.

children.name: getData()
children.text: Returns a single Data object, or null if the result is empty.

children.name: Array
children.text: The Data object formatted as an array.

children.name: toArray()
children.text:
Returns the transformed data as an array. This method turns a Data object into an
    array.

name: TransformResult - Scoped, Global
text: Provides the result of a transformation run on time-series data.
text2:
The TransformResult class can be used in scoped and global server scripts. When using the Transformer class, use the sn_clotho namespace identifier.

There is no constructor for this class. TransformResult objects are returned by many TransformPart methods.

This class is part of the MetricBase application.
